title: Litmos Completion Errors
content:
I am having issues with our Storyline published e-learning courses. I always test in Chrome and Firefox. We just had a Q3 release on October 3, so my testing was prior to October 3. All course completion reporting worked as it should in both Chrome and Firefox.

I have now started a new round of testing for a new course and my course completion reporting is reporting correctly in Chrome, but is not reporting correctly in Firefox. When I launch a course in Litmos in the Firefox browser and then exit the course before it is completed, the course is being marked as completed. When I launch the course again it does not pick up where it left off, the course starts over. I am wanting to convert back to an older version of Firefox to see if this resolves my issue, but I am not able to figure out how to do this.

Will you please tell me if this is a possibility or if there was something in the recent Firefox updates that would be causing this reporting issue within my course. I have tested my course in Chrome, no issues, I have tested my course in SCORM Cloud no issues, it is only happening in Firefox, which leads me to believe it is a Firefox issue.

Thank you so much for your help, Melanie

title: mozilla firefox apk
content:
Is there Mozilla Firefox for Android?


Mozilla Firefox for Android is a popular Firefox browser for Android devices. Some people have found that the app version of the browser is not as good as the desktop version, but it is still a popular choice. Firefox 4.0 on Android was released in early 2014 and there has been no major update released since then.


However, there is a new beta version of Mozilla Firefox for Android that is available now and it has some performance improvements. If you are using an Android device and want to try Mozilla Firefox for Android, you can download it from the Google Play store.


How do I install APK files in Firefox?


How to Install APK Files in Firefox is an article about how to install Android Policy APK files in Firefox. You can install APK files on your Android device using a file manager, or you can manually install these files by downloading them directly to your phone.


Is Mozilla Fire Fox safe?


Mozilla Firefox is a popular browser used by millions of people around the world. It has been in use for over 10 years and has been known to be safe. But what about now, with the recent data breaches and other risks associated with the internet?

Mozilla Firefox is an open source browser developed by Mozilla, which makes it more secure than mostBrowser windows on the market today. However, there are some risks that should be taken into account when using Mozilla Firefox, such as its reliance on third-party software – such as Adobe Flash – which can be vulnerable to cyber attacks.


Can I download Firefox for Windows 7?


If you are looking for a browser that is as efficient and popular as Mozilla Firefox, then you can download it for Windows 7. Firefox is a free software program that was created by the Mozilla organization. The software has been used to connect people around the world and is one of the most popular browsers on the internet. It can be downloaded from any website where downloads are available.


Can I install Firefox?


People are probably asking themselves if they can install Mozilla Firefox. Although it is a little complicated, the answer is most definitely yes! First, make sure that you have the appropriate permissions in your device’s settings. Second, find the Firefox app on your phone and install it. Third, open up Firefox and enjoy!

title: Adobe e-sign no longer working after update
content:
Hi all, I have an Adobe account and regularly use Adobe e-sign to send out contracts. I have recently updated Firefox and since then, when I try and send out PDFs for e-sign via Adobe Acrobat Reader, it doesn't get past the upload of the document stage. When I do it on the web browser, I can log in to my account fine, but as soon as I try and view the PDF I want to send for signature, it tells me that:

'The cookie functionality is disabled on your browser

Adobe Acrobat Sign has detected that the cookie functionality is disabled on your browser. To use Adobe Acrobat Sign, please enable cookies on your browser.

When cookies are enabled, click the 'Continue' button below to proceed to Adobe Acrobat Sign. Instructions for enabling cookies Safari for iOS Safari for Mac Chrome for phone or tablet Chrome for desktop OS Firefox 

   Click on the Firefox menu.    Select Preferences.    Select the Privacy & Security panel.    Select Standard to enable cookies.    Set Accept third-party cookies to Always to enable third-party cookies.'

I have followed all the above but it doesn't make any difference. I have also turned off Enhanced Tracking Protection for that site and it worked once, but then stopped working again.

I'm on a MacBook Pro.

Thanks so much for any help!


/edit: moved thread from Firefox for iOS (for iPhone/iPad) to Firefox section as you have macOS

title: Firefox is blocking access to Astound/wave.mail
content:
Firefox is denying access to Astound/wave mail. About 3 days ago Firefox posted a warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead. I am wondering if my recent activity is the cause. On October 23 my MasterCard account was charged $2.99 by a firm in Cyprus. MasterCard is investigating, and suggested that the card be cancelled, with a new card to arrive in the mail. They also advised that I alert my contacts that use MasterCard. In that process I attempted to change my password with Astound/Wave. But, every time I tried is was rejected. I Tried about a dozen times, one attempt right after another. I am thinking that that activity alerted Firefox that someone, other than me, was attempting to learn my information. Just seeing a dozen actions in a brief amount of time should have caused concern for me.

Is this possibly why Firefox is blocking our access to Astound/WAve mail?

Craig George

title: Lost my whole account setup
content:
Hello, I was trying to transfer my Firefox account to a new computer. It turned out I had forgotten my password and couln't find it written down anywehere. I also hadnt had any recovery key set up. I must also have missed the information that my data would be deleted if I set a new password. Here I am now having my account completely reset with all of my login-data and bookmarks that I had had for years lost. It is a very unpleasant situation to lose all of your browser setup all at once for something as simple as a password. I write to You to ask if anything could still be done to recover my previous setup. If not, then I would like this message to be considered as a customer complaint, since after all this data protection efforts, my data didn't get proteted but lost forever.

A separate issue I would like to write to you about is about a Russian search engine which had hacked the Firefox browser on my previous computer and kept setting itsself as my default search engine. I have my suspicions that it had managed to hack my operating system as well, since not long after I had to change my whole computer. All of this is raising concerns whether the Firefox Browser is as secure as I had thought.

Thank you in advance. With kind regards

Yavor K

title: Firefox loading no page since yesterday, but other browsers can. I have tried everything I could find!
content:
Hello!

My problem happened yesterday. I rebooted the PC and firefox did an update because I recognize a new layout of the logo in the top left corner. After that, I could load no page. They all tell me there is a security error and give the code PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR.

I have looked on the web (on Chrome and other browsers who work just fine) and found several ways of fixing this. I have tried them all, nothing worked. Here is a list of what I have done and didn't fix the issue: - Rebooting the computer. - Restarting the internet box - Re-installing Firefox - Doing the "repair" of Firefox - Changing the proxy settings to no proxy - De-activating my firewall while using it - Refreshing Firefox on my security app because it did not recognize it as the same application - Changing the vpn settings - Changing some settings in about:config (I undid all changes after verifying that they didn't work)

I'm sure I'm forgetting some.

Anyway, if you know of a way to help me, I'd be so thankful!

Thanks for reading me!

title: VPN DNS Leak
content:

Any suggestions?

I have opened a query with Xero Support, but they have pointed me to Firefox support.

Is there anything I can try? Has anyone come across this before?

Thanks in advance.
creator: neil.davies

title: Restoring tabs after refresh
content: I was browsing firefox when the browser began repeatedly crashing. After a couple crashes I was given an option to 'refresh' firefox after sending some data to mozilla, which I took. I have already tried going to about:sessionrestore and looking for a sessionrestore.json file to no avail. Is there any way I can recover my tabs (whether from a folder in my firefox profile, a possible automatic backup upon refresh, or, while unlikely, the data I sent to mozilla)?
